overview: Ariel Waldman is a digital anthropologist and the founder of Spacehack.org, a directory of ways to participate in space exploration and encourage citizen science. She is also a sci-fi movie gadget columnist for Engadget and the founder of CupcakeCamp, based off of the BarCamp model. In 2008, she was named one of the top 50 most influential individuals in Silicon Valley. Previously, she was a CoLab program coordinator at NASA, the community manager for Pownce, a P2P sharing social network, as well as a Digital Insights Analyst at VML, an interactive WPP agency, for 8 years.
